Issues.Title: Version 11 migrations remove non deprecated API
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/router ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: 10.1.6 ### Description A clear and concise description of the problem... Running ng update from 10.1.6 to 11.0.0-next.6 migrations remove usage of an API never documented as deprecated ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Have following code: ``` this.router.navigateByUrl(url, { queryParamsHandling: 'preserve', replaceUrl: true }); ``` Running migration changes it to: ``` this.router.navigateByUrl(url, { /* Removed unsupported properties by Angular migration: queryParamsHandling. */ replaceUrl: true }); ``` But queryParamsHandling is not deprecated! See https://angular.io/guide/deprecations#angularrouter where preserveQueryParams is deprecated and queryParamsHandling is documented as the replacement! See https://angular.io/api/router/NavigationExtras#queryParamsHandling where queryParamsHandling is clearly not deprecated but https://angular.io/api/router/NavigationExtras#preserveQueryParams is. ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 


Angular CLI: 11.0.0-next.7
Node: 14.14.0
OS: win32 x64

Angular: 11.0.0-next.6
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic
... router, service-worker
Ivy Workspace: Yes

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1100.0-next.7
@angular-devkit/build-angular   0.1100.0-next.7
@angular-devkit/core            7.3.10
@angular-devkit/schematics      7.3.10
@angular/cdk                    10.2.5
@angular/cli                    11.0.0-next.7
@schematics/angular             8.3.29
@schematics/update              0.1100.0-next.7
rxjs                            6.6.3
typescript                      4.0.3
**Anything else relevant?** not sure, perhaps this belongs in cli repo?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Version 11 migrations remove non deprecated API" (#39345)

Issues.Title: fix(ngcc): capture UMD/CommonJS inner class implementation nodes correctly
Issues.Body:
Previously, UMD/CommonJS class inline declarations of the form:

```ts
exports.Foo = (function() { function Foo(); return Fool; })();
```

were capturing the whole IIFE as the implementation, rather than
the inner class (i.e. `function Foo() {}` in this case). This caused
the interpreter to break when it was trying to access such an export,
since it would try to evaluate the IIFE rather than treating it as a class
declaration.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(ngcc): capture UMD/CommonJS inner class implementation nodes correctly" (#39346)

Issues.Title: build: revert back to downloading cldr-data directly rather than via npm
Issues.Body:

Issues.Title: fix(platform-server): Resolve absolute URL from baseUrl
Issues.Body:
This commit fixes a bug when `useAbsoluteUrl` is set to true and
`ServerPlatformLocation` infers the base url from the supplied
`url`. User should explicitly set the `baseUrl` when they turn on
`useAbsoluteUrl`.

**Breaking change:**
If you use `useAbsoluteUrl` to setup `platform-server`, you now need to
also specify `baseUrl`.
We are intentionally making this a breaking change in a minor release,
because if `useAbsoluteUrl` is set to `true` then the behavior of the
application could be unpredictable, resulting in issues that are hard to
discover but could be affecting production environments.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(platform-server): Resolve absolute URL from baseUrl" (#39334)

Issues.Title: i18n Ivy extractor only reports the first location context
Issues.Body:
Small repro in https://github.com/laurentgoudet/ivy-xi18n-bug. Steps: - Create a new project & `ng add @angular/localize` - Add `i18n` tags to a couple of tags, one of them being duplicated (https://github.com/laurentgoudet/ivy-xi18n-bug/blob/master/src/app/app.component.html#L343), to simulate the same piece of text being repeated across an application ```

Resources

Here are some links to help you get started:

Here are some links to help you get started:

``` - Run `ng xi18n`: the dictionary (https://github.com/laurentgoudet/ivy-xi18n-bug/blob/master/messages-ve.xlf) shows all the location references ``` Here are some links to help you get started: src/app/app.component.html 343 src/app/app.component.html 344 ``` - Run `ng x18n --ivy`: the dictionary (https://github.com/laurentgoudet/ivy-xi18n-bug/blob/master/messages.xlf) only shows the first location reference ``` Here are some links to help you get started: src/app/app.component.html 343 ``` This means translators have less context to understand how a piece of text is used across an app.

Issues.Body:

# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
<!-- Can you pin-point one or more @angular/* packages the are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: --> This feature request is for @angular/router


### Description
Allow replacing/extending/disabling the default functionality that sets of the current `history.state` on any router navigation to facilitate custom state objects.


### Describe the solution you'd like
Allow an easy to way replace/extend this functionality to manipulate the state along side the default functionality, or, less desirably, add an option to the `RouterModule.forRoot()` options to allow disabling this functionality.


### Describe alternatives you've considered
Currently, I am listening to `Location.onUrlChange()` and re-setting the state using the `replaceState()`, but I lose my previously set state when the navigation is not imperative, i.e. a back/forward on the browser.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Allow adding a function to replace/extend the default history.state manipulation" (#39327)

Issues.Title: refactor(compiler-cli): accept a host for reading project configuration
Issues.Body:
Currently the `readConfiguration` function in the compiler relies on the
file system to perform disk utilities needed to read determine a project
configuration file and read it. This poses a challenge for the language
service, which would like to use `readConfiguration` to watch and read
configurations dependent on extended tsconfigs (#39134). Challenges are
at least twofold:

1. To test this, the langauge service would need to provide to the
   compiler a mock file system.
2. The language service uses file system utilities primarily through
   TypeScript's `Project` abstraction. In general this should correspond
   to the underlying file system, but it may differ and it is better to
   go through one channel when possible.

As discussed in the LS sync, we decided to provide to
`readConfiguration` a host that would take of reading configuration as
needed for the use case of the caller. A first attempt was to put this
on `NgCompilerAdapter`, but this is not elegant because it introduces a
`CompilerAdatpter` dependency where there is no need for one (e.g. when
creating a watch mode host).

To be honest, I am not in love with the `ReadConfigurationHost`
delivered in this patch. I think it may be less hassle in the long term
and more ergonomic to create a `FileSystem` abstraction on a per-project
basis, delivered to the compiler whenever a new langauge service is
created. Let me know what you think.

Unblocks #39134

Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(compiler-cli): accept a host for reading project configuration" (#39325)

Issues.Title: refactor(compiler-cli): accept a host for reading project configuration
Issues.Body:
Currently the `readConfiguration` function in the compiler relies on the
file system to perform disk utilities needed to read determine a project
configuration file and read it. This poses a challenge for the language
service, which would like to use `readConfiguration` to watch and read
configurations dependent on extended tsconfigs (#39134). Challenges are
at least twofold:

1. To test this, the langauge service would need to provide to the
   compiler a mock file system.
2. The language service uses file system utilities primarily through
   TypeScript's `Project` abstraction. In general this should correspond
   to the underlying file system, but it may differ and it is better to
   go through one channel when possible.

As discussed in the LS sync, we decided to provide to
`readConfiguration` a host that would take of reading configuration as
needed for the use case of the caller. A first attempt was to put this
on `NgCompilerAdapter`, but this is not elegant because it introduces a
`CompilerAdatpter` dependency where there is no need for one (e.g. when
creating a watch mode host).

To be honest, I am not in love with the `ReadConfigurationHost`
delivered in this patch. I think it may be less hassle in the long term
and more ergonomic to create a `FileSystem` abstraction on a per-project
basis, delivered to the compiler whenever a new langauge service is
created. Let me know what you think.

Unblocks #39134
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "refactor(compiler-cli): accept a host for reading project configuration" (#39324)

Issues.Title: fix(compiler): preserve this.$event and this.$any accesses in expressions
Issues.Body:
Currently expressions like `$event.foo()` and `this.$event.foo()`, as well as `$any(foo)` and `this.$any(foo)`, are treated as the same expression by the compiler, because `this` is considered the same implicit receiver as when the receiver is omitted. This introduces the following issues:

1. Any time something called `$any` is used, it'll be stripped away, leaving only the first parameter.
2. If something called `$event` is used anywhere in a template, it'll be preserved as `$event`, rather than being rewritten to `ctx.$event`, causing the value to undefined at runtime. This applies to listener, property and text bindings.

These changes resolve the first issue and part of the second one by preserving anything that is accessed through `this`, even if it's one of the "special" ones like `$any` or `$event`. Furthermore, these changes only expose the `$event` global variable inside event listeners, whereas previously it was available everywhere.

Fixes #30278.

Issues.Title: Angular 7 : lazy loading compilation does not generate chunks without a force load.
Issues.Body:
In my application , lazy loading was perfectly working in Angular 4  . However , after I migrated to Angular 7 , the lazy loading and routing has stopped working when I use ng serve.

The routes for the application are defined in `app.module.ts` like this  :

			    RouterModule.forRoot([
				  { path: 'info/:gitCode/:pemCode/:getRtComponent', component: RedComponent },
				  { path: 'info/:gitCode/:pemCode/:getFaq/:getRtComponent', component: RedComponent },
				  { path: 'loadGuardsInfo/:gitCode/:pemCode/:getRtComponent', component: RedComponent },
				  { path: 'loadGuardsInfo/:getRtComponent', component: RedComponent },
				  { path: 'recDet', component: RecDetComponent },
				  { path: 'SlaveComponent/:pfScreen', loadChildren: './ally/slave/slave.module#SlaveModule' },
				  { path: 'MasterComponent/:pfScreen', loadChildren: './ally/master/master.module#MasterModule' },
				  { path: 'DashedComponent/:pfScreen', loadChildren: './ally/dashed/dashed.module#DashedModule' }
				  ])
			  ],
			  providers: [ReqService, { provide: APP_BASE_HREF, useValue: './' }, {
				provide: ErrorHandler,
				useClass: GlobalErrorHandler
			  }, { provide: LocationStrategy, useClass: HashLocationStrategy }],
			  bootstrap: [AppComponent],
			  exports: []

I have gone through a lot of articles on the internet about this and tried out a lot of things , but none worked . 

When I first try ng serve, I just get 6 chunks : `main.js, polyfills.js, runtime.js, scripts.js, styles.js and vendor.js` along with various typescript errors (I am okay with typescript errors since they are coming up as typescript has been updated from 2.4 to 3.1 and according to me they are expected and can be resolved) . What's strange is : when I now go to the `app.module.ts`, where my routes are mentioned and just try : CONTROL+S by introducing some blank characters using backspace , then all the lazy loading named chunks start showing up in the terminal . This issue is very similar to the issue that was reported by @ceyhunn here : https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/27023#issuecomment-491206139

Also , every lazy loaded  module , has a routing established in it like(e.g. for `SlaveModule`) :

     RouterModule.forChild([
      {path:'', component:SlaveComponent}
     ])

**Before the upgrade :**
[![enter image description here][1]][1]

**After the upgrade :**
[![enter image description here][2]][2]

Can the angular experts here tell me as to what's going wrong and how can I solve these issues ?

  [1]: https://i.stack.imgur.com/2N3We.png
  [2]: https://i.stack.imgur.com/zQrjl.png

I have raised the question in stackoverflow as well, but got no answer : https://stackoverflow.com/questions/64440466/angular-7-why-does-lazy-loading-compilation-does-not-generate-chunks
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Angular 7 : lazy loading compilation does not generate chunks without a force load. " (#19145)

Issues.Title: Prototype pollution in @angular-devkit/build-angular caused by object-path < 0.11.5
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [x] npm audit - [ ] new - [ ] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: `0.901.6`. The affected version of `@angular-devkit/build-angular` is `0.1001.7`. ### Description Executing `npm audit` results in a high vulnerability (prototype-pollution) found for `object-path` < `0.11.5`. See https://www.npmjs.com/advisories/1573 for further information. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction 1. Run `ng new repro-app && cd repro-app` 2. Install `@angular-devkit/build-angular` with version `0.1001.7` by running `npm i @angular-devkit/build-angular@0.1001.7` 3. (Run `npm audit`) ## üî• Exception or Error ## üåç Your Environment 
Angular CLI: 10.1.7
Node: 12.19.0
OS: darwin x64

Angular: 10.1.6
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic
... router, service-worker
Ivy Workspace: Yes

Package                            Version
------------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect          0.1001.7
@angular-devkit/build-angular      0.1001.7
@angular-devkit/build-ng-packagr   0.1001.7
@angular-devkit/core               10.1.7
@angular-devkit/schematics         10.1.7
@angular/cdk                       10.2.5
@angular/cli                       10.1.7
@schematics/angular                10.1.7
@schematics/update                 0.1001.7
ng-packagr                         10.1.2
rxjs                               6.6.3
typescript                         4.0.3
**Anything else relevant?** No.

<summary>webpack-contrib/mini-css-extract-plugin</summary>

### [`v1.1.0`](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/mini-css-extract-plugin/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​110-httpsgithubcomwebpack-contribmini-css-extract-plugincomparev100v110-2020-10-19)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/mini-css-extract-plugin/compare/v1.0.0...v1.1.0)

##### Features

-   added the `attributes` option ([e8a2d5a](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/mini-css-extract-plugin/commit/e8a2d5a09ded967e0f4be145f1f52c1e5f7f6df1))
-   added the `insert` option ([a5f17c4](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/mini-css-extract-plugin/commit/a5f17c48cbf0c198ebc955032d11593434ef2373))

##### Bug Fixes

-   ignore modules without identifier ([#​627](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/mini-css-extract-plugin/issues/627)) ([71a9ce9](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/mini-css-extract-plugin/commit/71a9ce91b377fff892068b87445372fe1c2db142))
-   remove `normalize-url` from deps ([#​623](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/mini-css-extract-plugin/issues/623)) ([9ae47e5](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/mini-css-extract-plugin/commit/9ae47e51f198f2e0258d0e87d6e708e57c05bf86))

##### [1.0.0](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/mini-css-extract-plugin/compare/v0.12.0...v1.0.0) (2020-10-09)

##### BREAKING CHANGE

-   minimum supported `Node.js` version is `10.13.0`
-   the `esModule` option is `true` by default, you need to change `const locals = require('./styles.css')`/`require('./styles.css')` on `import locals from './styles.css'`/`import './styles.css''`
-   the `moduleFilename` option was removed in favor the `filename` option
-   the `hmr` option was removed, HMR will work automatically when `HotModuleReplacement` plugin used or `webpack-dev-server` with enabled the `hot` option
-   the `reloadAll` was removed

##### Features

-   the `chunkFilename` option can be a function for webpack@5

##### ‚ö† NOTICE

To avoid problems between `mini-css-extract-plugin` and `style-loader` because of changing the `esModule` option to `true` by default we strongly recommend upgrading `style-loader` to `2.0.0` version.

##### [0.12.0](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/mini-css-extract-plugin/compare/v0.11.3...v0.12.0) (2020-10-07)

##### Features

-   opt-in to transitive only side effects (webpack@5), no more empty JS chunks

Issues.Title: Build failure with Webpack 5 dependency
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [x] build - [x] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? No ### Description My application package.json contains webpack 5.x dependency. This line of code imports file from webpack from `node_modules`: https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/ae94245131d883b5b060e8d6b6d05628bc448ea0/packages/ngtools/webpack/src/virtual_file_system_decorator.ts#L15-L16 Webpack from `node_modules/@angular-devkit/build-angular/node_modules/webpack/lib/node/NodeWatchFileSystem` should be used instead, if the file exists, otherwise fallback to `node_modules/webpack/lib/node/NodeWatchFileSystem` ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Run `npm install --save-dev webpack` ## üî• Exception or Error

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): add a base href to karma debug context
Issues.Body:
This commits adds a base href value in the karma context iframe used to run unit tests.

It solves #19116  where a unit test throws:

```
No base href set. Please provide a value for the APP_BASE_HREF token or add a base element to the document.
```

Even if the application is fine. This is because the index.html from Angular CLI contains a base href value, but not the Karma context iframe. So when adding a unit test with a testing module that imports a NgModule, for example AppModule, which itself imports RouterModule, the unit test used to throw an error (regression appeared in router 3.1).

That could be solved by either adding `RouterTestingModule` to the testing module, or by adding a provider `{ provide: APP_BASE_HREF, useValue: '/' }`, but required to understand the issue.

This solves the issue in a transparent way: developers won't even encounter the problem anymore.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): add a base href to karma debug context" (#19119)

Issues.Title: bug(Dialog Overlay): a11y screen reader issue reading overlay content in dialog
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction
This issue can be reproduced on the dialog example: https://material2-dev.firebaseapp.com/select 

Steps to reproduce:
1. Navigate to Dialog
2. Use the Voice Over (mac screen reader) and open the select drop-down
3. Try to navigate the option with UP/DOWN arrow key. The VO navigation doesn't select the options
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

What behavior were you expecting to see?
- Using VO is in safari, DOWN/UP arrow navigation should read/announce the select option.


#### Actual Behavior

What behavior did you actually see?
The screen reader does read the selected options in the select component inside the dialog model. 

Relate Issue: https://github.com/angular/components/pull/20695

#### Environment

- Angular: 9+
- CDK/Material: CDK
- Browser(s): Safari
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): macOS

GIF: http://www.giphy.com/gifs/ZGTv8ZW9I2UtXYOD0x

Issues.Title: add remove API to MDC chip harness
Issues.Body:
This allows MDC chips to be removed in testing environments.

Note that the harness must not only click on the remove button, but also dispatch a `transitionend` event. Without the dispatch of this event, the chip would not fire it's `removed` output.

This PR also includes a basic MDC ChipRemoveHarness that mirrors the non-MDC version. This was necessary to find the ChipRemove button in the chip harness' `remove` method.

Issues.Title: feat(material-experimental/mdc-chips): Allow custom role for chip set
Issues.Body:
The default mat-chip-set role is 'presentation' if chips are
present, and null if there are no chips. Some users want to
specify custom roles, in particular 'list' (they would use
'listitem' for the chips, which have no default role).
Currently this isn't possible, because mat-chip-set overwrites
their custom role with 'presentation'. Add an Input to allow a
custom role.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(material-experimental/mdc-chips): Allow custom role for chip set" (#20829)

Issues.Title: build: drop typescript 3.9 checks
Issues.Body:
Removes the TypeScript 3.9 checks since the framework is in the process of removing support (see https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/39313).

Also updates the Firebase functions to TS 4.0.

**Note:** this is merge-safe since it only changes build-related code.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "build: drop typescript 3.9 checks" (#20827)

Issues.Title: Align MDC-based chip harnesses with existing MatChipHarness
Issues.Body: The MDC-based chip harness is missing several APIs from the original due to some implementation differences between the two. We need to bridge this before the MDC-based component is considered fully stable.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Align MDC-based chip harnesses with existing MatChipHarness" (#20826)

Issues.Title: fix(material/autocomplete): options inside groups not read out with VoiceOver
Issues.Body: We're currently hitting a bug with `mat-autocomplete` that prevents options inside of `mat-optgroup` from being read out by VoiceOver on Safari. These changes implement an alternate accessibility pattern that only applies to options inside an autocomplete since the work correctly in `mat-select`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material/autocomplete): options inside groups not read out with VoiceOver" (#20819)

Issues.Title: Bug(mat-select): mat-select not showing mat-option
Issues.Body:
mat-option in not popping up in mat-select
```
<mat-form-field appearance="fill">
    <mat-label>Toppings</mat-label>
    <mat-select [formControl]="toppings" multiple>
        <mat-option *ngFor="let topping of toppingList" [value]="topping">{{topping}}</mat-option>
    </mat-select>
</mat-form-field>
```

```
import { FormControl } from "@angular/forms";

export class NewSalesComponent implements OnInit {
  toppings = new FormControl();
  toppingList: string[] = [
    "Extra cheese",
    "Mushroom",
    "Onion",
    "Pepperoni",
    "Sausage",
    "Tomato"
  ];

  constructor() {}

  ngOnInit() {}
}
```
stackblitz
https://stackblitz.com/edit/layouting?file=src%2Fapp%2Fnew-sales%2Fnew-sales.component.html
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/50950599/96242971-b17b5500-0fd6-11eb-8902-4e3a5585f2d6.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Bug(mat-select): mat-select not showing mat-option" (#20816)

Issues.Title: MAT-OPTION: Screen reader announces an option with label of "No" as "Number"
Issues.Body:
This issue was closed under #20810, however, I do believe it is an issue within angular material.  This issue occurs while using angular material version 10.2.1 but works fine under version 9.1.0.

#### Reproduction

**Angular Material v10.2.1** - https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-upbgwh?file=package.json **(doesn't work)**
**Angular Matearial v9.1.0** - https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-egx1ge?file=package.json **(works fine)**

Steps to reproduce:

Using version 10.2.1...

1. Run Chromevox extension
2. Tab to mat-select
3. Hit Enter to open drop-down
4. Use arrow keys to navigate to options
5. Listen to screen reader, when "No" is selected it will read "Number three of four". All other options read the label and then position correctly.

Using version 9.1.0...

1. Run Chromevox extension
2. Tab to mat-select
3. Hit Enter to open drop-down
4. Use arrow keys to navigate to options
5. Listen to screen reader, it will read No correctly

 
 
#### Expected Behavior

What behavior were you expecting to see?

It should read label and then position. For my example, it should read, "No, three of four"

#### Actual Behavior

What behavior did you actually see?

It reads, "Number three of Four". It looks like it is translating No to Number which is a shorthand for Number.

#### Environment

Angular: 10.1.0
CDK/Material: 10.2.0
Browser(s): Chrome  86.0.4240.75
Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows
ChromeVox: 53.0.2784.6
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "MAT-OPTION: Screen reader announces an option with label of "No" as "Number"" (#20815)
